messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] science stuff
messages.msgSnippet: Yes, Nancy we do get the Krampf weekly experiments.  Thanks Pat ... From: Nancy Wooton To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com Sent: Saturday, February 02, 2002
messages.messageBody:
Yes, Nancy we do get the Krampf weekly experiments. Thanks

Pat
----- Original Message -----
From: Nancy Wooton
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, February 02, 2002 9:31 PM
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] science stuff


on 2/2/02 4:58 PM, Pat Cald... at homeschoolmd@... wrote:

> I'm looking forward to making a cloud! He has lots of other cool ones too.
> Anyone else have any science stuff they like?
>
> Pat

Have you heard of the Experiment of the Week email list?

Description:
Weekly science experiments that can be done with household items. Topics
vary from physics, chemistry, biology, earth science, etc. Most are easy
enough for young students, and most can be adapted for older students and
adults.

krampf-subscribe@yahoogroups.com

Nancy

ADVERTISEMENT

messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] science stuff
messages.msgSnippet: The other day we were talking about how my dd thought in the future we wouldn t need hoses.  Well, I found a very good science experiment book in the library
messages.messageBody:
The other day we were talking about how my dd thought in the future we wouldn't need hoses. Well, I found a very good science experiment book in the library that will tie into this. The book is "39 easy meteorology experiments" by Robert W. Wood. I'm looking forward to making a cloud! He has lots of other cool ones too. Anyone else have any science stuff they like?

Pat


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
